intro: Pleianthemum, commonly known as the starflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Primulaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, yellow, or purple. They are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. Pleianthemum species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
